skill.name: e2e-testing-patterns
skill.description: Master end-to-end testing with Playwright and Cypress to build reliable test suites that catch bugs, improve confidence, and enable fast deployment. Use when implementing E2E tests, debugging flaky tests, or establishing testing standards.
skill.summary: Master end-to-end testing with Playwright and Cypress to build reliable test suites that catch bugs,...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill is instructional and contains only testing patterns and examples. It shows typical test framework usage with environment variables and network mocks, without any exfiltration or malicious execution.

content.value_statement: End to end tests often become flaky and slow. This skill gives Playwright and Cypress patterns to build reliable, fast suites.
actual_capabilities: Explains Playwright configuration for retries, reporters, and projects
Shows a Page Object Model pattern with Playwright examples
Provides stable waiting strategies and response handling examples
Covers Cypress custom commands and intercept usage
Includes visual regression, sharding, and accessibility testing patterns
limitations: Does not run tests or validate results in your environment
Does not install dependencies or set up CI pipelines
Does not generate selectors or test data for your application
Does not cover unit test implementation details

use_cases.title: Stabilize flaky tests
use_cases.description: Apply wait strategies and mocks to reduce failures in critical user flows.

use_cases.title: Create Playwright suites
use_cases.description: Design page objects and fixtures for consistent user journey tests.

use_cases.title: Define testing standards
use_cases.description: Set scope, selectors, and practices for team wide E2E testing.

prompt_templates.title: E2E basics plan
prompt_templates.scenario: New project with no E2E tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a minimal E2E strategy and two Playwright tests for login and checkout.

prompt_templates.title: Fix flaky waits
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my E2E wait usage and suggest stable alternatives to fixed timeouts.

prompt_templates.title: Design page objects
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a Page Object Model layout for login, dashboard, and settings flows.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced coverage plan
prompt_templates.scenario: Need cross browser and accessibility coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan using sharding, visual regression, and axe accessibility checks.

output_examples.input: Give me a stable Playwright login test pattern
output: Use role and label selectors for resilience
Wrap login steps in a page object
Assert URL change and dashboard visibility

best_practices: Use data attributes or accessible selectors for stability
Keep tests independent with clean setup and teardown
Prefer auto waiting assertions over fixed delays
anti_patterns: Relying on deep CSS selectors or nth child
Using fixed timeouts to handle async behavior
Coupling tests by sharing state across cases

faq.question: Is this compatible with Playwright and Cypress?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes patterns and examples for both frameworks.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and patterns but does not run or verify tests.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI pipelines?
faq.answer: It describes CI friendly patterns but does not configure your CI system.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It is instructional content and does not access user data.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot flaky tests?
faq.answer: Use targeted waits, network mocks, and isolated data setup per test.

faq.question: How does it compare to unit testing guidance?
faq.answer: It focuses on user journeys and E2E scope, not unit level logic.
